greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Let M_k be the k X k matrix M_k(i,j)=1/binomial(i+n,j); then a(n)=1/det(M_(n+1)).
formula: |a(n)| = det(M^(-1)), where M is an n X n matrix with M[i, j]=i/(i+j-1) (or j/(i+j-1)). |a(n)| = 1/det(HilbertMatrix(n))/n! = A005249(n)/n!. - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Jul 26 2003
program: def A069945(n): return (-1)^(n//2)*mul(binomial(i,i//2) for i in (1..2*n-1))
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Apr 27 2002
